page.title: 18THE GAELIC LANGUAGE
page.content: { Gaelic}is the language of{songs}and {feeling}on the island _ songs like {'Gleann Bhailachaiol!'!}But there are now just under{50 fluent speakers.}It is over 30 years since Gaelic was the language of the playground. Less than{50}years ago{bards}on the island were still{composing}the{words and{music}of beautiful songs like {'An t'eilein aluinn','An t'eilein beag {Liosach', 'Muile nam fuar bheann mor', (and hilarious ones too!) Now children learn in school, and for the{Mod.}We do have a tiny Gaelic {Playgroup,}and an evening class in Conversational Gaelic, and one five year old is partly{bilingual.}We have two visiting children who learn Gaelic here and back in Glasgow too. We perhaps need the polite Gael to speak to the Sassenach in his own tongue and demand an answer in Gaelic!
